verses.text: 要記念耶和華你的 神「我今日吩咐你的一切誡命，你們要謹守遵行，使你們可以存活，人數增加，並且可以進去得著耶和華向你們的列祖起誓應許的那地。

words.note: To keep in mind and recall.
Capitalized when referring to the LORD.
Formal term for ancestral lineage, common in biblical texts.

verses.text: 你也要記念耶和華你的 神這四十年在曠野引導你的一切路程，為要使你受苦，要試煉你，要知道你心裡怎樣，看看你肯守他的誡命不肯。

words.note: To keep in mind and recall.
Capitalized when referring to the LORD.
Often implies a refining or proving test.
Reduplication indicates a casual or softened action.

verses.text: 他使你受苦，任你飢餓，把你和你的列祖不認識的嗎哪賜給你吃，使你知道人活著，不是單靠食物，更要靠耶和華口裡所出的一切話。

words.note: More formal than 讓 (ràng), implying allowing something to happen.
Formal term for ancestral lineage, common in biblical texts.
Biblical miraculous food.
Often used for divine or superior giving.

verses.text: 這四十年來，你身上的衣服沒有穿破，你的腳也沒有腫起來。

words.note: Indicates duration from a past point to present.
Used as a locative suffix for 'body'.

verses.text: 因此你心裡要明白，耶和華你的 神管教你，好像人管教他的兒子一樣。

words.note: Capitalized when referring to the LORD.

verses.text: 所以你要謹守耶和華你的 神的誡命，遵行他的道路，敬畏他。

breakdown.m: by means of, in order to

words.note: Refers to the specific God, thus a proper noun here.
A key concept in biblical theology.

verses.text: 因為耶和華你的 神快要領你進入那美地；那地有河流，有泉，有源，水從谷中和山上流出來；

words.note: Refers to the specific God, thus a proper noun here.
Refers to the Promised Land.
A common verb-complement structure indicating outward flow.

verses.text: 那地有小麥、大麥、葡萄樹、無花果樹、石榴樹；那地有橄欖樹、油和蜜；

words.note: Lit. 'tree with no visible flowers before fruit'.

verses.text: 你在那地必不缺乏食物，在那裡你必一無所缺；那地的石頭就是鐵；從那裡的山上，你可以挖出銅來。

words.note: Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Idiom emphasizing complete provision.

breakdown.m: by means of, in order to

words.note: Indicates movement towards the speaker/point of reference.

verses.text: 你吃飽了，就要稱頌耶和華你的 神，因為他把那美地賜了給你。

words.note: Indicates completion of an action or change of state.
Refers to the specific God, thus a proper noun here.
Introduces the object of a verb, common in 'ba' constructions.
Refers to the Promised Land.
Indicates completion of an action or change of state.

verses.text: 「你要自己謹慎，免得忘記耶和華你的 神，不守他的誡命、典章、律例，就是我今日吩咐你的；

words.note: A specific way to write 'God' in some Chinese Bible versions, indicating reverence.

verses.text: 恐怕你吃飽了，建造美好的房屋居住，
你的牛羊加多，你的金銀增添，你所有的一切都增加了，
那時，你就心高氣傲，忘記了耶和華你的 神，就是把你從埃及地，從為奴之家領出來的那一位。

words.note: A specific way to write 'God' in some Chinese Bible versions, indicating reverence.
埃及 (Āijí) means Egypt, 地 (dì) means land.

verses.text: 他引導你走過那大而可畏的曠野，那裡有火蛇，有蠍子，有乾旱無水之地；他曾經為你使水從堅硬的磐石中流出來。

words.note: A classical literary possessive/structural particle.

verses.text: 他在曠野把你的列祖不認識的嗎哪賜給你吃，是要使你受苦，要試煉你，使你終久得到福樂；

words.note: Transliteration of Hebrew 'man'

words.definition: to want to, to be going to
to want to, to be going to

words.note: Often implies testing through hardship or purification.

verses.text: 恐怕你心裡說：『這財富是我的力量，是我手的能力使我得著的。』

words.note: Commonly used in classical or religious texts to mean 'to obtain'.

verses.text: 你要記念耶和華你的 神，因為得財富的能力是他賜給你的，為要堅定他向你的列祖起誓所立的約，像今天一樣。

words.note: In a religious context, implies remembering God's acts or character.
The preceding space often indicates reverence for 'God' in Christian texts.
Precedes a verb to turn it into a noun phrase, e.g., 'what was sworn'.

verses.text: 如果將來你真的忘記了耶和華你的 神，去隨從別的神，事奉和敬拜他們，你們必定滅亡，這是我今日警告你們的。

words.note: The preceding space often indicates reverence for 'God' in Christian texts.
Often implies following someone's lead or instruction.
Lowercase '神' refers to pagan deities or spirits, distinct from '　神' (God).
More formal or literary than '今天' (jīntiān).

verses.text: 耶和華從你們面前怎樣使萬國的民滅亡，你們也必照樣滅亡，因為你們沒有聽從耶和華你們 神的話。」

words.note: The preceding space often indicates reverence for 'God' in Christian texts.
